column1: When 40 cm³ of 0.5 M hydrochloric acid is mixed with 40 cm³ of 0.5 M sodium hydroxide solution, there is a temperature rise of ΔT. What would be the temperature rise if 60 cm³ of 1.0 M hydrochloric acid is mixed with 60 cm³ of 0.5 M sodium hydroxide solution ?
Which of the following statements concerning the oxides of elements in the third period of the Periodic Table is correct ?
column2: SiO₂(s) dissolves in water to form a neutral solution.
column3: P₄O₁₀(s) dissolves in water to form an acidic solution.
column4: Al₂O₃(s) dissolves in water to form an alkaline solution.
column5: Cl₂O₇(g) dissolves in water to form Cl₂(aq) and O₂(g) only.

column1:
Which of the following processes can form a halogen ?
(1) Electrolyse concentrated KCl(aq).
(2) Add Na₂SO₄(s) to concentrated HBr(aq).
(3) Add KI(s) to acidified KMnO₄(aq).

0.729 g of magnesium ribbon reacts with 50.0 cm³ of 0.50 M sulphuric acid. What is the mass of magnesium ribbon remained after the reaction has completed ?
(Relative atomic mass : Mg = 24.3)
Which of the following statements concerning francium (atomic number = 87) is correct ?
column2: Francium has a higher melting point than potassium.
column3: Francium forms cations more readily than potassium.
column4: Francium is a weaker oxidising agent than potassium.
column5: Francium has a fewer number of occupied electron shells than potassium.
